intro: Amsinckia tessellata var. gloriosa, commonly known as the gloriosa groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow, dandelion-like flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid environments.
